required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: SPIRIT EXTENSION: Efficacy and Safety Extension Study of Relugolix in Women With Endometriosis-Associated Pain
clinical_study.official_title: SPIRIT EXTENSION: An International Phase 3 Open-Label, Single-Arm, Safety and Efficacy Extension Study to Evaluate Relugolix Co-Administered With Low-Dose Estradiol and Norethindrone Acetate in Women With Endometriosis-Associated Pain

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the long-term efficacy and safety of relugolix 40 mg once daily co-administered with low-dose estradiol and norethindrone acetate for up to 104 weeks, on endometriosis-associated pain in patients who previously completed a 24-week treatment period in one of the parent studies (MVT-601-3101 or MVT-601-3102).

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is an international phase 3 open-label, single-arm, long-term efficacy and safety extension study that will enroll eligible patients who have completed their participation in one of the phase 3 randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled parent studies, MVT-601-3101 (SPIRIT 1 - NCT03204318) or MVT-601-3102 (SPIRIT 2 - NCT03204331). All patients will receive relugolix 40 mg once daily co-administered with low-dose estradiol (1.0 mg) and norethindrone acetate (0.5 mg) for up to 80 weeks.
Approximately 800 women with endometriosis-associated pain will be enrolled, after having completed a 24-week treatment period in one of the parent studies. The objectives of the study are to evaluate long-term efficacy and safety through up to 104 weeks of treatment (including treatment during the parent study) of relugolix co-administered with low-dose estradiol/norethindrone acetate.
Screening and baseline procedures will be done at the same visit for this extension study (referred to as the "Week 24/Baseline Visit"), which coincides with the Week 24 visit from the parent study, and will be defined as the date of completion of the last Week 24 procedure in the parent study. Patients will have received their last dose of study drug in the parent study on the day prior to the Week 24/Baseline Visit and will receive their first dose of study drug for this extension study in the clinic after the patient is determined to be eligible for this extension study and has provided informed consent to participate. The administration of the first dose of study drug for MVT-601-3103 will define enrollment into this study. Study participants will then take the open-label study treatment orally once daily for 80 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of women who respond or maintain a response based on daily assessment of dysmenorrhea
primary_outcome.description: Assessed using a Numerical Rating Scale (NRS) score (11-point scale) for pain recorded daily in an electronic diary.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of women who respond or maintain a response based on daily assessment of nonmenstrual pelvic pain
primary_outcome.description: Assessed using a NRS score (11-point scale) for pain recorded daily in an electronic diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in function due to endometriosis associated pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from parent study Baseline at Week 52 and Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using the Pain Domain of the Endometriosis Health Profile (EHP)-30 questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from parent study Baseline at Week 52 and Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using a NRS score (11-point scale) for pain recorded daily in an electronic diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in nonmenstrual pelvic pain NRS scores
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from parent study Baseline at Week 52 and Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using a NRS score (11-point scale) for pain recorded daily in an electronic diary.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from parent study Baseline at Week 52 and Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using a NRS score (11-point scale) for pain recorded daily in an electronic diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who are better or much better on the Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC) for dysmenorrhea
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from parent study Baseline up to Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: The PGIC for dysmenorrhea is a 1-item questionnaire designed to assess participants impression of change in the severity of pain during their menstrual cycle.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who are better or much better on the PGIC for nonmenstrual pelvic pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from parent study Baseline up to Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: The PGIC for nonmenstrual pelvic pain is a 1-item questionnaire designed to assess participants impression of change in the severity of pain when they are not menstruating.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients who are better or much better on PGIC for dyspareunia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from parent study Baseline up to Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: The PGIC for dyspareunia is a 1-item questionnaire designed to assess participants impression of change in the severity of their pain during sexual intercourse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the mean dysmenorrhea functional impairment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from parent study Baseline at Week 52 and Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using the subject modified Biberoglu and Behrman 5-point scale for dysmenorrhea recorded daily in an electronic diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the mean nonmenstrual pelvic pain functional impairment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from parent study Baseline at Week 52 and Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using the subject modified Biberoglu and Behrman 4-point scale for pelvic pain recorded daily in an electronic diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the mean dyspareunia functional impairment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from parent study Baseline at Week 52 and Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using the subject modified Biberoglu and Behrman 5-point scale for dyspareunia recorded daily in an electronic diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Patient Global Assessment (PGA) for function
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from parent study Baseline at Week 52 and Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: The PGA for function is a 1-item questionnaire designed to assess participants impression of how their pain affected their usual activities.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from parent study Baseline at Week 52 and Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: The PGA for function is a 1-item questionnaire designed to assess participants impression of the severity of their pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of responders based on their EHP-30 Pain Domain score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from parent study Baseline at Week 52 and Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using the Pain Domain of the EHP-30 questionnaire.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in each of the non-pain EHP-30 domains (Control and Powerlessness, Social Support, Emotional Well-being, and Self-Image)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from parent study Baseline at Week 52 and Week 104
from parent study Baseline at Week 52 and Week 104
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed by dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry scan.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number and percentage of participants with adverse events (AEs) as a measure of safety and tolerability
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed frequency and severity of AEs and serious AEs.
Blood samples will be collected from participants for estradiol measurements.

arm_group.description: Relugolix 40 mg co-administered with estradiol (1.0 mg) and norethindrone acetate (0.5 mg) for up to 28 weeks.

intervention.description: Relugolix 40 mg tablet administered orally once daily
Capsule containing co-formulated tablet of estradiol 1.0 mg and norethindrone acetate 0.5 mg administered orally once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Completed 24 weeks of study drug treatment and study participation in either MVT-601-3101 or MVT-601-3102.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Has had a surgical procedure for treatment for endometriosis at any time during the parent study (MVT-601-3101 or MVT-601-3102).
2. Met a withdrawal criterion in the parent study (MVT-601-3101 or MVT-601-3102).
